question:
In Britain, when someone gets old they often go to live in a home with
other old people where there are nurses to look after them. Sometimes
the government has to pay for this care.

Who do you think should pay for this care, the government or the family?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
text: Old-age is itself very complex part of life as compared to other phases. In countries like Britain where kids do not stay with their parents, there is a concept where old people tend to live together and generally, the Government pays for the nurse to look after.
The question arises that who should be liable to pay for these expenses? Whether it should be borne by the Government or by the Family of these fellows?
This essay will focus on the challenges being faced by people from Old age and share views on expenses too.

Old-age, bring a very critical time of one's life, where a person becomes sensitive enough to feel sick often, plus getting anything done without any help becomes difficult as well. It is good to know that despite living lonely, people choose to live with their fellow mates of same agegroup and intellect. They get to share their views and posses a one-generation mindset.

With growing age, everyone needs a little and in fact, continuous care which in return comes with a lot of expenses too. The fact that the Government bearing the cost shows that the country is taking care of their senior-citizens which anyone expects from his or her motherland, someone who has been an honest tax-payer, this is a way his/her country is thanking them. However, Although The Government pays for expenditures of nurse, I believe their family should also play a part here. As a kid, our parents have been taking care of us from the very beginning and it's the duty of kids to take care of them too. Besides the Nurse,there are some small expenditures too which can be borne by the family in a share.
